Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: gounta
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel lobby we knew we’d made a great choice. LOCATION: The Madera is a 3 minute walk to the Jordan MTR station, just off Nathan Rd, and within easy access to shopping and fantastic restaurants. TYPE OF ROOM: We booked a Deluxe Double (level 9-15) via the Iprefer program and hotel website. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a Grand Deluxe room on the 18th floor. The room was very modern, compact, with everything you needed, and a great use of space. The furnishings were new with bright colour schemes, matching artwork and décor. The iphone docking station was a nice touch. All of the light switches were touch switches, which was very stylish. There was a free (once off) mini bar in the room, something I haven’t experienced anywhere else. Our room was quiet, we didn’t hear a sound at night. Room price included a light breakfast of a coffee/tea and a pastry at the hotel café. BATHROOM/SHOWER: The bathroom was terrific. The bath was a jet bath (like a spa), with shower over head. The shower pressure was fantastic. Our bathroom had one hand basin, however I believe other types of rooms have 2 hand basins. Bathroom amenities were by Crabtree and Evelyn. There were even electronic scales in the bathroom, just in case you want to see how much weight you’ve put on from all of the delicious Hong Kong food. CLEANLINESS: The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. CLOSET SPACE: There was a closet with a safe inside, and a small area to store your bags. TV/INTERNET: There was a TV in the room with a good selection of channels, including quite a few English channels. Wi-Fi was provided throughout the hotel. SERVICE: From booking the hotel through to checking out all of the staff we dealt with were friendly, professional and very helpful. We were arriving around 8pm, and emailed the hotel prior to arrival to ask if they knew of a restaurant nearby to have roast goose. When we arrived the hotel had kindly booked a restaurant for us, and ordered ¼ of a goose. Upon check out the hotel staff offered to assist us with ordering a Taxi or getting to the airport. The staff also directed us to their onsite gallery to have a look. It’s quite a credit to the hotel that they have put this space together, which takes you through the history of Hong Kong. OVERALL: For the location and price of this hotel, I doubt you’d find better in Hong Kong. It’s a hidden gem, and one that won’t stay hidden for much longer. Enjoy it while its still new.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with reasonable cheap price”
Reviews.Author: devilton
Reviews.Content: Saw online that it was a very new and clean hotel yet going for S$180+, so booked it for my trip. The lobby is very modern and conceige staff are good enough for my expectation. When entered the room, was very surprised that it was very beautiful and neat. Also that the drinks and snacks are all free too but only for that one time, no refill, which is not very fair for those who stayed many nights like me but then again, almost all other hotels charge for those things. Most importantly, they have free wifi throughout without any limitation to the number of user. The bed is very comfortable with nice pillows. Full wall window, perfect if with nice view. Haha. The bathtub comes with jacuzzi which my daughter, wife and I enjoyed a lot. My room even has a extra small room acting as a study room and wardrobe but not for my friend's room. It seems that it's slightly different from room to room. They have safe for valuable too. I left coins for their housekeeping meant as tips and it was untouched till the last day, very trustworthy keepers. This hotel has a very fun part, they have a room that keeps lots of vintage stuff, really enjoyed ourselves in there taking photos and fooling around. :) Please spend some time at the top floor lounge if you have the time, it is a very nice place to chill but they close at 11pm. Saw that they have car racing room but didn't get to try that, maybe next time. Last but not least, the hotel is very near to the Jordan MTR and 10 mins walk to reach Tsim Sha Tsui. There are many convenient shops to buy grocery and daily products, many good eateries too. Seriously, as long as the price doesn't go up by too much, I would stick to this hotel whenever I visit HK or an even better deal hotel comes along. I highly recommend this hotel to those who wants a very good hotel with good location and is ok with the extra bit of budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: 154hILLS
Reviews.Content: The Madera is very handy to Jordan metro. You must but an Octopus metro ticket. For us seniors we paid only $HK2 (NZ33cents) per ride. A small hotel with only 5 rooms per floor. Bar is on level 29, so the view is good - the service average. Comfortable room with a few little odd features.

Reviews.Title: “very near to Jordan mtr nice rooms too”
Reviews.Author: Fannkoh
Reviews.Content: very new n nice hotel near to Jordan mtr w massage bath tub(although I never got e chance to try it). but whoever 1 of the front staff who is a young guy w spec was quite unhelpful when we check in n realize tt I left my stuff on e coach n ask him to help but he juz simply brush it off to call e centre ourselves n it's not only one occassion but on e few occasion when we request for help his answer is always v firm when rejecting us w/o even trying to help. got v bad impression of him. he is always at e front desk but however there's another man who is also w spec is v helpful n cheerful not like e younger guy who nv smile thru out our stay at all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel1128
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in June 2012. The room I had was nice, modern and clean. The size was very respectable for a Hong Kong hotel. The front desk is always friendly and helpful and there is a nice steamboat & wine bar opposite. The hotel also has a small and adequately equipped gym on the 3rd floor. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to lay your head after a 13 hour flight!”
Reviews.Author: cmando
Reviews.Content: What a relief after a long to flight. The room was a reasonable size, clean and modern. The front desk was polite and quick to get me my key. The only thing that could have been better was the view, but not a big deal to me. Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “good location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: vio86
Reviews.Content: we book the hotel because it just newly open in early 2012. i start to regret when the front desk staff proceed the room check in, the cant find my booking and only found my friend's which we book together at the same time in an same email. i raise up the tone then they start to search for my booking again and they got my booking just after i ask them search again. They allocated us in 1 room 1st because another room is no ready yet, we are fine it, but the room they allocated us is a handicap room which i think they should keep the room to the person who needs that facilities more than us. we request to change the room and the staff" Andrew" help me to process immediately, after than he bring us to the new room seems everything is in order. Suddenly we saw the a pack of chips at the mini bar already been opened. He clear away the chips and compensate 2 pack to us. The aircon abit noisy and will generate auto flush sound every 1hr if you are light sleeper please on your fan speed at least 2 and above as per answer from the hotel technician. request hypoallergy room if you are sensitive with the fur or hair as the carpet have very thick layer of fur and will come up after walk on it. i request to change the bed sheet due to my friend say her leg start to come out red spot which is the sign bite by the bed bugs after 1 night sleep on that bed. luckily the red spot no increase after hotel change the bed sheet. goods: 1) near to the MTR exit B , just 2 street distance and can take the lift from MTR to ground floor(street) , good for the family who have young children and need travel by the pram. 2) the bathtub have the Jacuzzi function. and shower area separate. 3) the socket in used can suit the plug used in Singapore and Malaysia. 4) free welcome mini bar and WIFI. 5) good for the iphone user as can charge the iphone using the dock speaker. 6) walking distance to temple street. 7) the hotel will take in the action right after received the feedback from the customer. will come back to stay if the service improve and the room rate have promotion

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient option for HK”
Reviews.Author: beroccstar
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Madera. The location was perfect - right in the center of things but just far enough away to be quiet and relaxing. We found a Michelen star rated restaurant right across the road (it's a pretty dark quiet street so this was an unexpected find) which we really enjoyed - and it was open at a really late hour too. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Amenities were quite comically modern.. interesting lighting arrangements, automatic music (unfortunately we were woken up by this on our first night as it seems to have been accidentally programmed to switch on at 7am - an explanation at check-in about how to use it would have been nice), and an iphone/ipod stereo (sorry not sure exactly what it was but we don't have any i-toys so it didn't apply to us ;) The room was a strange set-up: the office desk/chair was in a separate and very tiny room together with the closet and fridge. I presume this is to try to make the best use of the extremely limited space (it's not big by any account but I'm guessing it might be standard or even spacious for HK). The worst thing was the shower, which for some reason pointed in a funny direction and got everything a bit wet... it also tended to form a bath as you showered, not draining very quickly... this could have been a fault with our room though. All in all we were happy with the standard for this price - it was quite comfortable, clean and tasteful. We will probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Lrose12
Reviews.Content: We booked premier suite for 3 nights. Upon check-in, we have been upgraded to penthouse. It's at the highest floor and 2 storey with living room on lower floor and bedroom on upper level with 2 bathrooms. The room size is spacious. The staff are courteous, friendly and always attend to our needs. Location is good, nearby restaurants and shops. The drawbacks are the cleaning service is not thorough in cleaning the rooms and can hear the noise when neighboring room turns on the water especially in the middle of the night. Other than this, everything is wonderful. We would definitely like to stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: CdnTraveller20
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening in an upgraded room. Fantastic value and very convenient location (just two short blocks away from Jordan MTR subway station). All amenities in room very very upscale. The bathroom had dual sinks and a deep tub jacuzzi - perfect for relaxation after a long day of business. Location is short taxi ride away from Kowloon Airport Express station. Right across the street is a Michelin-rated Cantonese restaurant. Temple street night market is also close by for kitschy shopping at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happychen
Reviews.Content: I happened to end up in Madera by chance and I believe I was lucky the rooms are nice, very simple but good design, the service was helpful and smily, overall it was a great stay and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and comfortable with a good location”
Reviews.Author: dannyVMelb
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with small stylish room that fit the bill for what we needed. Shocking view of a dump below from our room but great view from the roof bar. Staff were quite friendly. In hindsight I'd probably spend a bit more and stay in a better room or at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but Lacking”
Reviews.Author: wookiefurball
Reviews.Content: This hotel had quirky and modern decor and the rooms were very new and nice but was lacking in other areas. The cleaning service was very poor. They would just make the bed and not really do anything else. They offered free internet and snacks/drinks in the room but the snacks and drinks are never replenished so eat/drink sparingly! The bed was pretty hard but the size of the room was very comfortable. We booked a room with free breakfast and the Cafe 1997 on the 3rd floor was tiny but very adorable. We could get a free coffee and a pastry (very limited with only 6 choices). The location is good if you don't prefer being near the water. It is walking distance to the Temple Street Markets and a lot of sub stations. The customer service was excellent and the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. There is no shuttle service but is easy to get to from the airport. Overall, good price for the quality of the room but if you are looking for a hotel which offers more amenities like a full restaurant, business center, or pool, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Comfortable, Convenient & Value-For-Money”
Reviews.Author: FnE_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a superior twin room on the 6th floor and visited Mongkok, Ap Lei Chau, Causeway Bay, Central, Ocean Park, The Peak, Apliu Street, TST, etc. Location & Accessibility: This new boutique hotel is easily recognizable on Cheung Lok Street. No problem with taxi drivers. No probelms getting taxis, buses, mini-buses. A 5 minute walk from exit B1 Jordan MTR. Hotel Lobby & Design: Reception is pretty small but nicely decorated, there is a smallish gallery on the ground floor with a touch of old Hong Kong, great for pictures. Nice boutique feel, overall. Vicinity: There's a traditional HK teahouse (Victory Restuarant) opposite the hotel that serves great breakfast/lunch at affordable prices. Love the luncheon meat with egg rice... Plenty of eating joints and there are a few convenience stores, medical halls, pharmacies littering the area so everything is pretty convenient. Use the underpass at Saigon Street (parallel to Cheung Lok Street) to get to more good food stops and Temple Street Night Market just across the road. Service: Personally, I felt hotel service was above average. Everyone was really helpful and nice, advising on the weather conditions and passing us umbrellas :) Especially the door man / concierge guys. Housekeeping was tip-top. They were always greeting us and smiling. Rooms: Nicely decorated in contemporary style and everything is clean and new. They provide full range of toiletries and an all-you-can help yourself mini-bar (chips, coke, beer, water) that gets replenished daily. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. For the price you're paying the room size is decent, compared to other hotels in the Mongkok/Nathan Road area. By the way, layout and size of superior and deluxe rooms are exactly the same, except the deluxe rooms are situated on higher floors.... Cons (for us): The hotel is totally non-smoking and they do not serve breakfast (or actually they do on Level 3 at the Cafe but mainly pastry and stuff) and there was no room service for our late night supper but then again, there are plenty of food joints a stone's throw away. My overall take is that for the price we paid we got a good deal, we've stayed at other hotels in the area and paid more for less. Even local friends who visited us here shared the same view. Well, catch it while it's new as I think it's only a matter of time before they increase their prices.... Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Wistin
Reviews.Content: Hotel have nice and creative decorations which make the small space have better look, in room have comfort facilities, new looks, but room size seem small. Hotel located on convenience area and easily to access other area by public transport, banking, shopping and other.

Reviews.Title: “great new rooms, great rate”
Reviews.Author: capsacin
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was so great, I actually signed up for an account at TripAdvisor just to write my first review! My mom and I stayed in a twin room for 2 nights. The room size is decent, compared to other hotels I've stayed in HK. The bathroom is clean and modern, and the shower's water pressure was fantastic! (I think these rooms would be good for couples or close family members, because you can still see what's going on in the bathroom behind the translucent glass walls.) The wifi was fast and stable, and there are plenty of electrical outlets around the room to plug stuff into. Being on Nathan Rd and less than 5mins away from the Jordan station was also very convenient. I thought the service was decent. The staff at the counter were always nice and greeted me when I entered/exited the hotel. I also had some large packages to wrap and they didn't really have the right tools to help me with that, but they did recommend where nearby I could go get some, while they stowed my stuff. There's no hotel breakfast, but it's not a huge deal for me, since it's HK and there's food everywhere. The air ducts (or plumbing from another room?) did make some periodic strange noises, but overall, everything else about the hotel made up for it. There's a very cute hotel cafe on the 3rd floor which was great for just hanging out, waiting for visitors. And a neat museum on the base floor to wander around in. The best part about the hotel was the rate. It was cheaper than a couple other places I've stayed at (mainly ones that keep popping up on internet hotel searches for this price range and star grade), and the newness and MTR location are key. There were no reviews for this hotel when I first booked it, so I'm quite happy with the chance I took. I figured, it's a new hotel, it should be nice :) I would definitely come back to this hotel, but I'm kind of afraid that I had paid a "new hotel" promo rate, and that it'll go up a lot the next time I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eelms
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Madera Hong Kong from 20-23 April. This is a fairly new hotel and due to a great offer, we were able to get a deluxe twin room at a discount. The rooms are really much bigger than the average room you'd get from a hotel of the same grade. It is just a short walk away from Jordan MTR. Decor wise, it keeps things simple and adopts a neutral color scheme without glaring colors, for which I'm very happy about. The only gripe we have is the extra powerful air-conditioning. It was really super cold even though we adjusted the temperature to 30 degrees C! We had to switch it off at night while we sleep and wake up some time in the night to switch it on again as it was getting pretty stuffy. That said, we didn't inform the hotel about this. This could have been a case of faulty thermostat. I'd 100% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very New. Very Chic. Definitely Worth the Dollar”
Reviews.Author: jensen0332
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 22-25 Apr. Was rather skeptical before arriving at the hotel. Cause like the rest, we couldnt find any reviews abt this new hotel. But after 3 nights' stay, I must say, this is definitely the no. 1 choice if u visit hk and r looking for a value-for-money hotel. Madera is definitely the best in its category (for now). First: Its new. Just had its official opening in late march. Everything in the hotel, from the lobby to the lifts to corridors to the rooms smells fresh. Design is chic and stylish. Second: The rooms. We (couple) stayed in a standard room. Room size is acceptable. Cause in hk, we dont expect a really spacious room, esp for the price we pay. In fact, it was far better than we expected. beside the common sleeping area, there is another corner where u find a wardrobe, safe deposit box and a mini-bar (YES! everything is complimentary and is replenished every single day!) Lightings r adjustable according to your 'mood'. Bathroom comes with a jaccuzi bathtub which is a plus for us. Third: The staff. Not always very friendly but definitely very helpful. Never fail to clear our doubts and enquiries. Makes us feel like home. Fourth: The location. As mentioned by the other reviewers, its conveniently located 5mins from the JORDAN MTR station (Exit B1 or B2). Besides that, just opposite the hotel is a restuarant/ shop selling nice affordable red and white wines. Slightly to the right is Plaza 18 (18广场). At the 1st floor of this plaza is a chinese restuarant (新斗记), who serves very nice authentic HK/ chinese cruisine (e.g. roasted goose). Its worth a try if u wana splurge and indulge alittle. For those who wana experience hk nightlife and is too lazy to go all the way to Lan Guai Fwong (兰桂坊), there is a Club 18 on the 14th floor (of Plaza 18). Its not a bad place to people watch. Try going after 10pm. thats when the crowd and pretty people starts arriving. Overall, Madera is definitely worth staying. Definitely worth every single dollar. Will come back if I ever visit HK again. Hopefully its standard will remain the same. If not better

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hismanto
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice interior, fast wifi, 5-10 mins walk from Jordan subway/metro (MTR), very helpful and friendly staffs : I complained about noise from aircond ducting, they responded promptly -and gave me another room. I stayed in room 2302 (: master bedroom + living room/pantry + small bedroom + bathroom with bathtub/jacuzzi.)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique feel and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Jamieee23
Reviews.Content: We are a cpl in our late twenties, stayed for 2 nights and haven't got a bad word to say about the Madera. There were no TA reviews when we booked as the hotel is brand new but we're glad we did and I can see good reviews coming thick and fast. Room was a good size, large by HKG standards with a pretty good view (we were on floor 21). Staff v.friendly and helpful. Brilliant decor and boutique feel makes the price well worth it. It's a 20min walk down Nathan Road to the Star Ferry and a stones throw from Temple St night market so great location. We used the gym which was small but perfect for a quick run and weights sesh. Bar with roof terrace gives brilliant view of Kowloon and accross to HK island. Would def recommend to anyone and stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Madera Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.1 Cheong Lok Street, Jordan, Hong Kong, China
